commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi, 1 run, OUTvery full on middle and leg, hoicked away into the leg side. Bishnoi scampers back for the second and why not! But he's caught short on the second at the striker's end, despite a full-length dive. Caught well shortRavi Bishnoi run out (Philippe/†Wade) 4 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 133.33
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi, out Ravi Bishnoi Run Out!! 1 run completed. Full delivery at the stumps, Bishnoi flicks it straight to deep mid-wicket and decides to make the most of it, he goes for the second run and is caught well short of the crease. Philippe with the pick up and throw while Wade did the rest at the striker's end. Ravi Bishnoi run out (Philippe/Head) 4(3)

commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi, 1 run, OUTvery full on middle and leg, hoicked away into the leg side. Bishnoi scampers back for the second and why not! But he's caught short on the second at the striker's end, despite a full-length dive. Caught well shortRavi Bishnoi run out (Philippe/†Wade) 4 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 133.33
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi, wide, Wade saves a few for his team. Horrible delivery from Behrendorff, way down leg and it needed a full dive from Wade to just parry the ball to short fine. Avesh wanted a single but Bishnoi sends him back

commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi, 1 widevery full and veering down the leg side, wide called. Great stop from Wade behind the stumps
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi, out Ravi Bishnoi Run Out!! 1 run completed. Full delivery at the stumps, Bishnoi flicks it straight to deep mid-wicket and decides to make the most of it, he goes for the second run and is caught well short of the crease. Philippe with the pick up and throw while Wade did the rest at the striker's end. Ravi Bishnoi run out (Philippe/Head) 4(3)

commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi, 1 widevery full and veering down the leg side, wide called. Great stop from Wade behind the stumps
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi, wide, Wade saves a few for his team. Horrible delivery from Behrendorff, way down leg and it needed a full dive from Wade to just parry the ball to short fine. Avesh wanted a single but Bishnoi sends him back

commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi,  2 runsback of a length and angling into middle, hoicked away to deep square, where Short, I think, takes it on the half-volley
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi, 2 runs, angled in from round the wicket, Bishnoi pulls it towards deep square leg where McDermott takes it on the half volley, the batters go back for the second even though Bishnoi lost his bat at the non-striker's end and make it in comfortably

commentary: Behrendorff to Avesh Khan,  1 runanother pinpoint yorker, squirted out to mid-off
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Avesh Khan, 1 run, yorker around off, Avesh digs it towards cover and gets off strike

commentary: Behrendorff to Chahar, OUTslower ball, 111ks, on a length and outside off, Chahar winds up for a big hit but can't clear the man at long-on. Green, the debutant, slides on his knees and grabs itDeepak Chahar c Green b Behrendorff 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Chahar, out Caught by Chris Green!! Another batter bites the dust looking for quick runs. India have lost 4 wickets in the last 9 balls. This was in the slot but since it was the slower ball, Chahar could not generate power on his heave, mistimes it towards long-on and Green runs in to take an easy catch. Chahar c Chris Green b Behrendorff 0(2)

commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi,  1 runfull-toss on middle, slogged away to deep midwicket
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi, 1 run, full toss around leg, Bishnoi mistimes the heave to deep mid-wicket

commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh, OUTyorker from Benrendroff. He gets it to tail in from left-arm over the wicket and has Rinku falling over slightly. Pinged on the back pad. No bat involved. Given out lbw. Rinku has asked for a review. It would've just clipped leg stump, enough for umpire Madanagopal's on-field out call to be upheld. No fifty for RinkuRinku Singh lbw b Behrendorff 46 (29b 4x4 2x6 50m) SR: 158.62See all photos
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh, out Lbw!! That looked more out on first instance than it did on ball-tracker. Rinku departs but does not waste a review. India losing their way a bit towards the end. This was the yorker from Behrendorff and Rinku fails to get his bat down to keep it out, struck low on the pad and right in front of the stumps, ball-tracking showed it to be just brushing leg-stump. Rinku is disappointed but has to walk back. Rinku Singh lbw b Behrendorff 46(29) [4s-4 6s-2]

commentary: Dwarshuis to Chahar, no runback of a length and skidding away outside off, Chahar is beaten on the outside edge
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Chahar, no run, excellent over from Dwarshuis, 7 runs and 2 wickets. Back of a length delivery angled across, Chahar has a tentative poke and is beaten on the outside edge. He was looking to steer it to third man

commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar Patel, OUTSangha takes it at the edge of the long-on fence. Sangha is confident that he's taken it. The on-field umpires refer it to the TV umpire to confirm it. Yep, that's a clean catch. Axar has to depart for a duck. Banged in short and cramps him for room, who pulls weakly to SanghaAxar Patel c Sangha b Dwarshuis 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar, out Caught by Sangha!! Another catch taken right on the edge of the rope. This time it is Sangha. Short ball and Axar went for the help-it-along pull shot and gets more of a top-edge, the ball skies towards fine leg and Sangha settles under it, he takes the catch and steps back a couple of times but ensures he does not touch the ad cushions. Axar c Sangha b Dwarshuis 0(1)

commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar Patel, OUTSangha takes it at the edge of the long-on fence. Sangha is confident that he's taken it. The on-field umpires refer it to the TV umpire to confirm it. Yep, that's a clean catch. Axar has to depart for a duck. Banged in short and cramps him for room, who pulls weakly to SanghaAxar Patel c Sangha b Dwarshuis 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar, wide, goes for the toe-crusher but sprays it down leg, Axar misses the glance and it is called a wide

commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar Patel, 1 widevery full and slanting down the leg side, wide called
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar, out Caught by Sangha!! Another catch taken right on the edge of the rope. This time it is Sangha. Short ball and Axar went for the help-it-along pull shot and gets more of a top-edge, the ball skies towards fine leg and Sangha settles under it, he takes the catch and steps back a couple of times but ensures he does not touch the ad cushions. Axar c Sangha b Dwarshuis 0(1)

commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar Patel, 1 widevery full and slanting down the leg side, wide called
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar, wide, goes for the toe-crusher but sprays it down leg, Axar misses the glance and it is called a wide

commentary: Dwarshuis to Sharma, OUTattempted yorker, which comes out as a full-toss outside off. Holes out to Head at long-off. Jitesh winds up once again, but Head holds onto the ball at the edge of the boundary. Jitesh finishes with 35 off 19 balls at a strike rate of 184.21Jitesh Sharma c Head b Dwarshuis 35 (19b 1x4 3x6 23m) SR: 184.21See all photos
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jitesh Sharma, out Caught by Head!! That's a good take by Head. But Jitesh would be disappointed as this was not a wicket-taking delivery - high full toss outside off, Jitesh goes for the big swing down the ground and the bat turns on impact, he miscues it towards long-off and Head takes a well-judged catch just in front of the rope. A handy knock from Jitesh comes to an end. He gave India the much needed impetus after Gaikwad's departure. Jitesh Sharma c Head b Dwarshuis 35(19) [4s-1 6s-3]

commentary: Dwarshuis to Sharma,  2 runson-pace wide yorker, jammed out to deep cover
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jitesh Sharma, 2 runs, very full and outside off, Jitesh shuffles and scoops it over extra over, couple more

commentary: Dwarshuis to Sharma, FOUR runscrashed through extra-cover. Another attempted slower ball, on a length and outside off, Jitesh sizes it up and carts it away to the off-side fence
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jitesh Sharma, FOUR, slower ball outside off, Jitesh stays deep in the crease and bashes it past extra cover. He delayed his bat swing a touch and hence could generate the power

commentary: Dwarshuis to Sharma, no runslower yorker from left-arm over, Jitesh can't dig it out as the bowler hides it away from his reach
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jitesh Sharma, no run, nails the wide yorker outside off, Jitesh fails to dig it out and it is a dot to start

commentary: Behrendorff to Sharma,  1 runon-pace full ball outside off, just short of a yorker length, Jitesh drills it down to long-off
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, too full and around off, Jitesh drives down to long-off and brings up the 50-run stand. Important partnership for India

commentary: Behrendorff to Sharma,  2 runsslowie outside off, Jitesh swings for the hills and drags the ball away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jitesh Sharma, 2 runs, winds for the big heave to the leg-side but ends up dragging it off the inner half wide of long-on, just a brace

commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh,  1 runyorker, tails in at the base of leg stump, jammed down to long-on
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh, 1 run, very full delivery and right in the blockhole, Rinku digs it out to long-on

commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh,  2 runschest-high short ball, another slower variation from Behrendorff. Rinku delays his pull and places it to the right of short fine
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh, 2 runs, short and bowled into the wicket, Rinku plays a controlled pull backward of square and races back for the second

commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh, FOUR runsmuch fuller and veering down the leg side, with fine leg up in the circle. Rinku glances it away to the right of that infielder
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh, FOUR, just wide of Sangha. Slower ball but drifts down leg, Rinku helps it along the way past a diving short fine

commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh, FOUR runsskewed in the air. Slower ball from Benrendorff. Knuckle ball? Rinku somehow gets it away from the reach of both the keeper and short third
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh, FOUR, streaky! Not where Rinku intended but he gets the boundary. He wanted to lap it round the corner into the leg-side but ends up getting a top-edge, the ball flies over Wade and races away..

commentary: Hardie to Sharma,  SIX runslovely work. He gets inside the line of the bouncer angled into middle and off and because of that he is able to launch the ball over fine leg. Superb shot
second_commentary: Hardie to Jitesh Sharma, SIX, turns into a good over for India. Hardie misses his radar with the short of length delivery, around leg-stump and Jitesh gets inside the line, pulls it Calypso style over fine leg

commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh,  1 runcramps him going on pace on middle and leg, Rinku turns it to long-on
second_commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, 1 run, good length ball on off, Rinku bunts it to mid-wicket and settles with a single

commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, FOUR runsslower short ball and Rinku spots it, holds his shape and pulls it powerfully in front of square leg for a boundary
second_commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, FOUR, another slower ball but dug into the surface, Rinku waits and nails the pull in front of square, well wide of deep mid-wicket

commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, no runslower ball this time, outside off stump, well away from Rinku's reach. This has been a very good over so far from Hardie
second_commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, no run, slower ball outside off, Rinku goes chasing and is deceived by the lack of pace

commentary: Hardie to Sharma,  1 runmis-hit to mid-off. Jitesh charges at the fast bowler, who goes high-pace and into the wicket. He gets good bounce, cramps him too, and that makes sure the batter can't get any timing
second_commentary: Hardie to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, shimmies down and is met by that hard length, Jitesh still goes through with the cross-batted shot and gets it high on the bat, lobs in front of mid-off and lands safely

commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh,  1 runswivels on the back foot and pulls the short ball angled into him from around the wicket to deep square leg
second_commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, 1 run, short and angled in from round the wicket, Rinku pulls to long leg

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma, no runlooks for the reverse sweep, but Sangha does well to hide the ball outside off stump and away from the reach of Jitesh's bat swing.
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, no run, slower and Jitesh premeditates the reverse sweep, he's through the shot and the ball arrives later. Excellent spell from Sangha comes to an end and he finishes with figures of 4-0-30-2

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma,  2 runscrashes it through the covers, capitalising on the room to free the arms
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, 2 runs, short and spinning away, Jitesh cuts in front of square on the off-side and picks up a brace

commentary: T Sangha to Rinku Singh,  1 runbacks away and cuts a shortish ball outside off through point
second_commentary: Sangha to Rinku Singh, 1 run, drifting away from the southpaw, Rinku cuts square of the wicket and the sweeper tidies up

commentary: T Sangha to Rinku Singh, no rungoes back to punch a flatter delivery on middle down to the bowler
second_commentary: Sangha to Rinku Singh, no run, shortens the length and keeps it tight, Rinku knocks it back to Sangha

commentary: T Sangha to Rinku Singh, no runhangs back against the flatter delivery, which seems to go on with the arm away from the left-hander. Rinku cuts to point
second_commentary: Sangha to Rinku Singh, no run, short and turning away, Rinku cuts and picks out backward point

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma,  1 runtossed up on off stump, defends off the front foot into the covers
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, tossed up and Jitesh angles it towards point, picks up a quick single

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma,  1 runtossed up on off stump, defends off the front foot into the covers
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, wide, wayward delivery well outside off, Jitesh lets it go and collects the wide

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma, 1 widevery wide outside off, no need to chase those
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, tossed up and Jitesh angles it towards point, picks up a quick single

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma, 1 widevery wide outside off, no need to chase those
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, wide, wayward delivery well outside off, Jitesh lets it go and collects the wide

commentary: Green to Sharma,  1 runon a length and slid across off, 104ks, stabbed down to long-off
second_commentary: Chris Green to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, drifted across the right hander, Jitesh drives to long-off and retains strike

commentary: Green to Sharma, no runGreen drags his length back outside off, better length. Jitesh swings so hard that he loses his balance and misses
second_commentary: Chris Green to Jitesh Sharma, no run, drags the length back and slows it up a tad, Jitesh is through the shot early and is beaten on the outside edge

commentary: Green to Sharma,  SIX runsJitesh clears long-off with ease. Pushed through full and outside off, can't be this full. Jitesh gets underneath the length and smites it over the outfielder
second_commentary: Chris Green to Jitesh Sharma, SIX, second six in the over. Fired full and outside off, Jitesh had the space to free his arms and there's no half measures from him, he goes full throttle on the lofted drive and sends it sailing over extra cover

commentary: Green to Sharma, no runfull-toss outside off, belted back to Green, the ball bursts through the hands of the bowler. It does not stick, leaving the umpire in the firing line as well
second_commentary: Chris Green to Jitesh Sharma, no run, was that a drop? High full toss and Jitesh does not quite get hold of the shot, smacks it straight back at Green and the ball passed him before he could react, strikes umpire Anantha Padmanabhan and goes to ground. The umpire apologises to Jitesh for costing him some runs

commentary: Green to Sharma,  SIX runsslog-swept over the midwicket boundary! Pushed through too full on middle and leg, Jitesh sinks to one knee and monsters Green over the leg side. Bam
second_commentary: Chris Green to Jitesh Sharma, SIX, Jitesh doesn't take long to get going. But this ball was right in the arc, he shuffles across and bends down to get under it, launches it high and well over deep square leg. Even Rinku is impressed..

commentary: Green to Rinku Singh,  1 runon a length and on off stump, tapped to mid-off
second_commentary: Chris Green to Rinku Singh, 1 run, flatter and not much flight, Rinku knocks it wide of cover and quickly crosses over

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma, no runjabbed away to short cover on the back foot
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, no run, quicker delivery around off, Jitesh eases it to cover

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma,  2 runschipped in the air but away from the reach of midwicket
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, 2 runs, in the air and wide of mid-wicket. Drifting into the pads, Jitesh whips it aerially and just manages to evade the fielder. Head dived to his right but the ball was well away from him

commentary: T Sangha to Rinku Singh,  1 runclipped away through midwicket on the back foot
second_commentary: Sangha to Rinku Singh, 1 run, slower but shortens the length, Rinku nudges it through mid-wicket

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma,  1 rungoogly, finishes on leg stump, but the length is short, allowing Jitesh to punch off the back foot to long-on
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, flatter and quicker, Jitesh knocks it to long-on

commentary: T Sangha to Gaikwad, OUTCaught by Dwarshuis at short third this time. Nicely tossed up on off and breaks away. Gaikwad, having manufactured swinging room, throws his bat at ball and aims to go over extra-cover. But can only slice it off the outside half to short thirdRuturaj Gaikwad c Dwarshuis b Sangha 32 (28b 3x4 1x6 58m) SR: 114.28
second_commentary: Sangha to Gaikwad, out Caught by Dwarshuis!! The partnership has been broken. A well-set Gaikwad departs and Sangha has picked up his second wicket. Flighted delivery on off, Gaikwad backs away to play the inside out loft but the ball just grips a little, takes the outer half of the bat and balloons towards short third, simple catch for Dwarshuis. Gaikwad c Dwarshuis b Sangha 32(28) [4s-3 6s-1]

commentary: T Sangha to Gaikwad, FOUR runsflat and fast, breaks away outside off, Gaikwad latches onto it and chops it away between point and short third
second_commentary: Sangha to Gaikwad, FOUR, shot! This is a fraction short and Gaikwad is quick to pounce, he goes back and cuts it behind square on the off-side, splitting backward point and short third perfectly

commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh,  SIX runsdown the track and smoked over wide long-on. This is another serious strike from Rinku. He charges at Dwarshuis, manufactures his own length - a half-volley - and powers the ball over the leg sideSee all photos
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh, SIX, massive, biggest six of the night - charges down the pitch, takes the momentum into the shovel and sends it soaring into the stands - into the second tier of this massive stadium, that's some hit

commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad,  1 runback of a length and angling across off, Gaikwad deliberately opens the bat-face and guides the ball to deep point
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, 1 run, on a good length and angling across the right-hander, steered square past point for a single

commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh,  1 runRinku rides the bounce of this shortish ball outside off and dinks a single to deep third
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Rinku runs it down towards third man for a single

commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad,  1 runshorter and on top of the stumps, worked away into the leg side
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, 1 run, Dwarshuis drags the length back on off, tucked wide of mid-wicket for a single

commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, FOUR runson a length and on middle, Gaikwad sizes it up and pumps it over mid-on with a high elbow. He holds his shape and hits over the topSee all photos
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, FOUR, lovely, length ball on middle - Ruturaj gets forward, presents the full face of the bat, high elbow and a straight bat, launches it back over the bowler's head, held his pose as he watched the ball bounce away to the ropes

commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh,  1 runbunted down to mid-on
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, pushed in front of mid-on for a quick single

commentary: MW Short to Rinku Singh,  1 runchopped away to deep point on the back foot
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Rinku Singh, 1 run, flighted delivery outside off - punched behind square on the off-side for a single

commentary: MW Short to Gaikwad,  1 runshort and angling across off, chopped away to sweeper cover on the back foot
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Gaikwad, 1 run, the slider from Short, angled across the right-hander and it's chopped square on the off-side for a single

commentary: MW Short to Rinku Singh,  1 runclipped away through square leg for a single
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Rinku Singh, 1 run, tossed up on middle and leg, nudged behind square on the on-side for a single

commentary: MW Short to Rinku Singh,  SIX runslaunched over point with a reverse-sweep or rather a switch-hit. Special shot from Rinku. He takes it from the stumps and clears the boundary. SKY is up on his feet, applauding in the dugout
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Rinku Singh, SIX, beautifully played, Rinku brings out the switch-hit, reversed the stance, bent low and then swiped it over backward point - powerfully struck and it sails over the ropes

commentary: MW Short to Rinku Singh, no runflighted on middle from round the stumps, pushed back to the left of Short who makes a sprawling save
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Rinku Singh, no run, Short tosses one on off, pushed back at the bowler

commentary: MW Short to Gaikwad,  1 runslog-swept away to deep square
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Gaikwad, 1 run, flighted delivery from round the wicket - slugged away behind square on the on-side for a single

commentary: Green to Gaikwad,  1 runshorter and into the pitch, 94ks, rushes Gaikwad into a pull. Hauled away to deep midwicket
second_commentary: Chris Green to Gaikwad, 1 run, pushed through by Green, Ruturaj is hurried onto the pull and mistimes it past mid-wicket for a single

commentary: Green to Gaikwad, no rungood length and sliding into off stump, defended back to Green on the front foot
second_commentary: Chris Green to Gaikwad, no run, flighted delivery on off, defended back at the bowler

commentary: Green to Rinku Singh,  1 runwhisked away to wide long-on
second_commentary: Chris Green to Rinku Singh, 1 run, tossed up on off, stayed a fraction low and it's pushed down to mid-on for a single

commentary: Green to Gaikwad, 1 leg byevery full and drifting down the leg side, tickled away fine past the keeper
second_commentary: Chris Green to Gaikwad, leg byes, 1 run, too straight from Green, brushes Ruturaj's pad as he looked to flick, rolls past short fine for a leg-bye

commentary: Green to Rinku Singh,  1 runtucked away off the hips to deep square leg
second_commentary: Chris Green to Rinku Singh, 1 run, tossed up on middle and leg, tucked past square leg for a single

commentary: Green to Rinku Singh, no runpushed through on off, played back to Green
second_commentary: Chris Green to Rinku Singh, no run, flighted delivery on off, defended back at the bowler

commentary: T Sangha to Gaikwad, no runslider outside off, chopped away to short third
second_commentary: Sangha to Gaikwad, no run, tossed up well wide of off, Ruturaj finds backward point with the cut

commentary: T Sangha to Gaikwad,  SIX runswalloped over the midwicket boundary. Thigh-high short ball, angling into middle, Gaikwad goes back and pulls it flat and hard over the leg side
second_commentary: Sangha to Gaikwad, SIX, crunched, a long hop from Sangha - Ruturaj picks the length early, swivels across and then hammers the pull over wide mid-wicket for a maximum

commentary: T Sangha to Rinku Singh,  1 runshort and skidding into the hips, tucked away behind square on the leg side
second_commentary: Sangha to Rinku Singh, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, nudged behind square on the on-side for a single

commentary: T Sangha to Gaikwad,  1 rundragged short and wide of off, slapped away to sweeper cover
second_commentary: Sangha to Gaikwad, 1 run, dragged short and wide of off, slapped to deep cover for a single

commentary: T Sangha to Gaikwad, no runplayed back to Sangha
second_commentary: Sangha to Gaikwad, no run, tossed up on middle and leg, defended to the on-side

commentary: T Sangha to Rinku Singh,  1 runtossed up and breaking into the pads, flicked away to deep midwicket
second_commentary: Sangha to Rinku Singh, 1 run, flighted delivery on off, worked in front of square on the on-side for a single

commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, no runback of a length and outside off, punched on the up to extra-cover
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, no run, on a length and pushed across the right-hander, punched straight to the fielder at cover

commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh,  1 runon a length and on the pads, tucked away to deep midwicket
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the pads, clipped in front of square on the on-side for a single

commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh, FOUR runship-high short ball outside off, Rinku latches onto it and swats it away to the left of midwicket
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh, FOUR, cracking shot, dragged short and well wide of off, Rinku picks the length early, swivels across and then pulls it wide of mid-wicket, runs away to the ropes

commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad,  1 runfull and swinging into middle and leg, flicked away to deep square
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, 1 run, fuller length delivery on off, clipped off the inner half past mid-wicket for a single

commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh,  1 runon a length and outside off, guided away between point and cover
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Rinku pushes it into the gap square past point for a single

commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar, OUTedged and taken by Wade! Full and darted across off stump from left-arm over. Some away movement from Dwarshuis. SKY has a loose push and snicks it behind to WadeSuryakumar Yadav c †Wade b Dwarshuis 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 50See all photos
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Wade!! A loose drive and India have lost their captain now, the Raipur crowd has been stunned into silence, was a good length delivery that was angled across the right-hander - Suryakumar was playing for the straighter line, but he's undone by the angle, gets an audible edge and Wade does the rest. Two big guns back in the hut and India find themselves in some trouble. Suryakumar Yadav c Wade b Dwarshuis 1(2)

commentary: T Sangha to Suryakumar,  1 runtossed up and breaks away outside off, SKY slices it away to the off-side sweeper
second_commentary: Sangha to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, flighted delivery outside off, Suryakumar leans forward, opens the face of the bat and finds the gap wide of cover with the drive, off the mark with a single

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, OUTHoles out to Green at long-on! Sangha tosses it up liberally on off stump, Iyer usually backs himself to hit out against spin. He aims to clear long-on, but does not find enough power or elevation this time. Green, the debutant, snags the catchShreyas Iyer c Green b Sangha 8 (7b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 114.28See all photos
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Chris Green!! A mistimed hoick and Shreyas has holed out to long-on - was nicely tossed up and Shreyas was shaping for the big hit over long-on, but the ball held up onto the surface and the Indian number three ended up dragging it off the lower half of the bat - Green runs across to his right at long-on and holds onto a simple catch. Shreyas Iyer c Chris Green b Sangha 8(7)

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer,  2 runsshovelled down to wide long-on off the back foot
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, tossed up on off, worked off the back-foot, into the pocket wide of long-on and Shreyas saunters back for the second

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer,  2 runson the hips, picked away between deep midwicket and deep square
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, flatter and at the pads, whipped past square leg and Shreyas is back for another brace

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer,  2 runswristed away to the right of mid-on
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, the leg-break from Sangha, but the length is short and it lets Shreyas adjust his shot, dabs it with soft hands towards mid-on and scampers back for the second

commentary: T Sangha to Gaikwad,  1 runchopped to point
second_commentary: Sangha to Gaikwad, 1 run, flighted delivery outside off, Gaikwad went hard on the drive and mistimed it wide of cover-point for a single

commentary: Green to Gaikwad,  1 runon a length and on middle, 98.7ks, Green keeps darting the ball into the pitch, jabbed down to long-on
second_commentary: Chris Green to Gaikwad, 1 run, tossed up on off, worked down towards long-on for a single

commentary: Green to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runfull and breaking into middle and leg at 99.3ks, worked away through the vacant midwicket region once again
second_commentary: Chris Green to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Green drifts one on middle and leg, turned past square leg for a single

commentary: Green to Gaikwad,  1 runGaikwad shuffles across and nurdles a single into the leg side
second_commentary: Chris Green to Gaikwad, 1 run, flighted on off, Gaikwad prods across and pushes it wide of mid-wicket for a single

commentary: Green to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runpushed through flat and fast on middle and leg, bunted down to long-on
second_commentary: Chris Green to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Green tosses one on middle and leg, Shreyas gets going with a neat little tuck down to long-on

commentary: Green to Shreyas Iyer, no runback of a length and slides on outside off at 97.6ks, stabbed back to Green
second_commentary: Chris Green to Shreyas Iyer, no run, flighted delivery outside off, pushed back at the bowler

commentary: Green to Gaikwad,  1 runclipped away through the vacant spaces at midwicket for a single
second_commentary: Chris Green to Gaikwad, 1 run, tossed up on off, worked wide of mid-wicket for a single

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, OUTIndia lose Jaiswal on the last ball of the powerplay! Cross-seam short ball outside off from Hardie. He runs in hard, hits the deck even harder and finds extra bounce to mess with Jaiswal's pull. He can only flap it to McDermott running around from mid-onYashasvi Jaiswal c McDermott b Hardie 37 (28b 6x4 1x6 27m) SR: 132.14See all photos
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, out Caught by McDermott!! Hardie troubled Jaiswal in his first over, he now has his man. Was a hard length delivery around off, bowled into the surface and Jaiswal is hurried onto the pull, hit high on the bat and the ball lobbed over mid-on - McDermott has plenty of time to track back, he keeps his eyes on the ball and holds onto a simple catch. Jaiswal c McDermott b Hardie 37(28) [4s-6 6s-1]

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no runshort and just a shade outside off, Jaiswal leans back and forces the ball to extra-cover
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, punched off the back-foot to the off-side

commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad,  1 runon a length and angling into off stump, squeezed down the ground for a single
second_commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, 1 run, on a length and at the stumps, pushed in front of mid-on for a single, brings up India's 50

commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no runHardie tests the middle of the deck and bangs a bouncer. Gaikwad ducks under it safely
second_commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no run, banged in short by Hardie - Gaikwad ducks under and lets it go

commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no runHardie tests the middle of the deck and bangs a bouncer. Gaikwad ducks under it safely
second_commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, wide, full and well down leg, past Gaikwad's flick and is called as a wide

commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, 1 wideleg-side wide from Hardie as Gaikwad can't glance it away
second_commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no run, banged in short by Hardie - Gaikwad ducks under and lets it go

commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, 1 wideleg-side wide from Hardie as Gaikwad can't glance it away
second_commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, wide, full and well down leg, past Gaikwad's flick and is called as a wide

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal,  1 runshorter and slanted across off, Jaiswal leans back and elegantly cuts it to square-ish third
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, 1 run, Hardie shortens the length outside off, steered behind square on the off-side for a single

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, FOUR runsfullish and pushed across off, Jaiswal lines it up and pumps it straight over Hardie's head. Reward for attacking intent
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, FOUR, hammered, a cross-seam delivery from Hardie, but it's too full - lets Jaiswal clear his front-leg and then lift it back over the bowler's head, couple of bounces and over the ropes

commentary: Green to Jaiswal,  1 runskidder from Green, cramps Jaiswal and has him hastily chopping to point
second_commentary: Chris Green to Jaiswal, 1 run, the slider from Green, drifted back into the left-hander and cramped him for room, chopped wide of cover foir a single

commentary: Green to Jaiswal,  SIX runsmight have been a seam-up delivery outside off or rather the arm ball, shortish and sits up to be smacked. Jaiswal obliges and sends the ball clattering over the midwicket boundary
second_commentary: Chris Green to Jaiswal, SIX, clubbed, a half-tracker from Green - Jaiswal rocks back and then thumps the pull over mid-wicket, went sailing a long way over

commentary: Green to Jaiswal,  2 runshard-length delivery at the body from round the stumps, rushes Jaiswal into a pull. Flapped over midwicket
second_commentary: Chris Green to Jaiswal, 2 runs, an ill-timed muscle, but Jaiswal gets away with it - was short ewnough for the pull, but it hurried onto him and robbed him of all timing, gets enough to clear mid-wicket

commentary: Green to Jaiswal, FOUR runsdragged short and wide of off stump, skids off the deck, Jaiswal latches onto the width and slaps it away between point and short third
second_commentary: Chris Green to Jaiswal, FOUR, cracking shot, dragged short and wide of off - Jaiswal backs away and then cuts it square behind point, races away to the ropes

commentary: Green to Gaikwad,  1 runstraighter one outside off, Gaikwad searches for turn and ends up wafting it to the covers
second_commentary: Chris Green to Gaikwad, 1 run, nicely tossed up on off, nudged in front of square on the off-side for a single

commentary: Green to Gaikwad, no runback of a length and swinging into the top of off stump, defended back to him
second_commentary: Chris Green to Gaikwad, no run, fraction short and a hint of drift across the right-hander, defended back at the bowler

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no runback of a length and on top of the stumps, punched back to the bowler with a high elbow
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no run, on a good length and angling back into the left-hander, cramped for room, Jaiswal pushes it back at the bowler

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no runjust short of a good length and outside off, possibly a slower one, chopped hard to point
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no run, slower short ball outside off, cut straight to the fielder at cover-point

commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad,  1 runGaikwad push-drives to mid-off and scampers across to the other end
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, 1 run, fuller length delivery on off, driven to the right of mid-off for a single

commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, FOUR runsshort and wide once again, Gaikwad hits the gap this time. Cuts away between left of point and right of deep third. Sangha dives to his left in vain in the infield
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, FOUR, short, wide and four, width on offer from Behrendorff - Gaikwad rfeaches out, uses Behrendorff's pace and then steers it backward of square on the off-side for a boundary

commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, no runshorter and wider of off, chopped hard to point by Gaikwad on the back foot
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, no run, Behrendorff shortens the length and angles one across the left-hander, chopped straight to the fielder at backward point

commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, no runback of a length and angling across off, Gaikwad sits back and pats it defensively to short cover
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Gaikwad gets behind the line and defends it to the off-side

commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, no runback of a length and on middle and leg, defended by Jaiswal to close out the over
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, no run, Dwarshuis shortens the length around middle, Jaiswal leans across and defends it to the on-side, 12 off the over

commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, FOUR runsDwarshuis searches for inswing and ends up spraying it down the leg side. Jaiswal picks it up once again and whips it over backward square leg for another four
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, FOUR, another half-volley from Dwarshuis - at the pads and it's nonchalantly whipped away, over backward square leg for a boundary

commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, FOUR runspicked away to the left of mid-on this time. Shot, Jaiswal. A bit too full and on the pads, duly put awaySee all photos
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, FOUR, cracking shot, a leg-stump half-volley from Dwarshuis, Jaiswal gets inside the line and then brings his wrists into play, whipping it over mid-wicket for a boundary

commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, no runshortens his length and tries to tuck the batter up, squeezed to mid-off
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, no run, fuller length delivery on off, Jaiswal prods forward and pushes it to mid-off

commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, FOUR runsoverpitched on the stumps, floated up, Jaiswal leans into an on-drive. Shows the full face of the bat and caresses it straight of mid-on
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, FOUR, beautifully played, overpitched by Dwarshuis - Jaiswal leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and then plays a lovely on-drive, between the non-striker and the man at mid-on

commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, no runback of a length and outside off, jabbed into the covers
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jaiswal, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, driven straight to the fielder at cover-point

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal,  1 runJaiswal leans back to this short ball outside off and chops it down to square-ish third. Well controlled by Jaiswal
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, chopped away behind square on the off-side for a single

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, 4 byesbeats Jaiswal. Beats the keeper as well. Rears up from a back of a length outside off. Jaiswal slashes and misses. Wade leaps and misses. This took off like a rocket
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, byes, FOUR, extra bounce and the ball climbs over Wade's leap - bonus runs for India, banged in short and the ball took off, over Jaiswal's attempted cut and kept gaining in height, giving Wade no chance

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no runsliced away to the right of point. Jaiswal eyes up a single but has to undo his steps. Dot
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no run, tad fuller and wider of off, Jaiswal leans across and plays a push-drive to backward point

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal,  2 runsback of a length and homing in at off, tip and run to point. They get another run, thanks to an overthrow
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, 2 runs, on a good length and just outside off, dropped in front of cover-point and they're off for a quick single, there's a shy at the striker's end and an overthrow is conceded

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no runback of a length and sliding into off stump, stabbed back to Benrendorff
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, Jaiswal went hard on the drive and mistimed it back at the bowler

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, FOUR runscarved away between point and cover-point. Jaiswal gets this away. On a length and outside off, Jaiswal deliberately opens the bat-face and dinks it away
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, FOUR, lovely, Jaiswal is finally off the mark - fuller length delivery and well wide of off, Jaiswal leans across, plays with an open face and finds the gap wide of cover-point with a free-flowing drive

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, 1 leg byeback of a length and skidding off the deck, but does not bounce as much as Jaiswal expected it to. He does not meet with a pull and Hardie spins around for an lbw appeal. Not given out on the field. Wade challenges the on-field not-out decision. Beats the bat and hits the back pad just above the knee-roll. Okay, ball-tracking confirms that this had pitched outside leg
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, leg byes, 1 run, loud shout for LBW and we've a review - did look close, but was the angle taking the ball past the off-stump, stayed a tad low and beat Jaiswal's attempted pull - no bat and UltraEdge confirms it, but it does look like the angle will save the left-hander - the off-stump is vidible and ball-tracking shows that the ball pitched just outside leg, so the original call stays and Australia lose a review

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no runJaiswal drives on the up but can't find the gap between extra-cover and cover-point
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, Jaiswal leans across and can't beat cover-point with the drive, pressure buildiong on the young opener

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no runon a length and nips back in at off stump, weakly pushed to mid-off off the inner half
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no run, on a good length and just outside off - Jaiswal gets well forward and drives it to mid-off

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no runmuch fuller and wider of off, Jaiswal reaches out and carves a drive to cover-point
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no run, fraction fuller and wider of off, Jaiswal creams the drive and finds the fielder at cover

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no runon a length and largely holds its line outside off, Jaiswal gets his feet moving and push-drives to mid-off this time
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no run, on a good length and just outside off - Jaiswal gets a good stride forward and finds mid-off with the drive

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no runpitched-up delivery, slanting away outside off, Jaiswal slashes and does not connect
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no run, fuller length delivery and a hint of swing back into the left-hander, Jaiswal's feet went nowhere as he swung and missed
